author: Ben Otto
title: Rohingya Camps in Bangladesh Start to Look Permanent
text:
COX’S BAZAR, Bangladesh—Sprawling and ramshackle camps housing hundreds of thousands of Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh are quietly taking on features of more permanent settlements—with roads, bridges, wells, schools and medical centers.
The transformation is a tacit acknowledgment by aid agencies—and the Bangladeshi government—that the Rohingya won’t be returning soon to villages in neighboring Myanmar that they have been fleeing since last August to escape ethnic and religious violence.
